meanings.definition: A person or thing that sanctifies.
meanings.sent1: The priest acted as the sanctifier during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The ancient artifact was believed to be a powerful sanctifier.
meanings.sent3: The magical wand turned out to be a sanctifier for the cursed objects.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a sanctifier, bringing peace to all who saw it.
meanings.sent5: The old book served as a sanctifier, guiding the lost souls to redemption.

meanings.definition: One who makes holy or purifies.
meanings.sent1: The saint was known as a great sanctifier in the community.
meanings.sent2: The water from the sacred spring was considered a powerful sanctifier.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat fancied itself a sanctifier of the household by chasing away mice.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a sanctifier, cleansing the doubts from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise acted as a sanctifier, painting the world in golden purity.
